appearances.title: U.S. Senate U.S. Senate : CSPAN2 : January 12, 2026 2:59pm-6:56pm EST
appearances.snippet: thanks to speaker johnson, house appropriations committee chair tom cole and others, the house passed a three-bill appropriations package, commerce, justice, and science, energy and water development, and interior and the environment, by an overwhelming bipartisan margin. now it's our turn. i hope that we will be able to get these bills passed here in the senate in the next couple days. we have a lot of appropriations work to do before the january 30 deadline, and we should not waste any time in getting this bipartisan package over the finish line. mr. president, it's difficult to overstate just how dramatically the situation at the southern border has changed over the past yooers year. in -- over the past year. in november, the latest month for which we have border numbers, there were just 11,000 total encounters. 11,000. now, to put that number into perspective, mr. president, the previous november, under president biden, saw 94,000 encounters. the number before that saw a staggering -- i should say the november before that saw a staggering 242,000 encounters. and the number before

appearances.snippet: i'm proud to be under the leadership of of tom cole. uh, i have never seen a committee, and i know i've been on your committee as well. uh, i've never worked this hard in my life, but i've never been more proud of what i am able to do in this body. on this committee. i urge passage of this bill. thank you. and i yield back. >> gentleman. yields back. gentleman. oklahoma reserves gentlelady is recognized. >> mr. speaker, i yield two minutes to the gentleman from indiana, a member of the appropriations committee. mr. >> gentleman from indiana is recognized for two minutes. >> i thank the ranking member for this time. since my first day as an elected official, i sought to serve on the house appropriations committee because the work of this committee is so critical to the economic success of our nation and the safety of our communities. this focus and the interest is also what led me to choose to be a member of the energy and water subcommittee and the commerce, justice and science subcommittee. and i am so pleased today that a reasonable a

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 14, 2026 1:30pm-3:42pm EST
appearances.snippet: i got to start with the remarkable leadership of chairman tom cole. we wouldn't be here discussing this if it wasn't for her and his partner on the other side of the aisle. and i'm so grateful for your leadership, your recommendations. every single member has made this bill so much better. it's shaped this bill, and i'm grateful for the contributions i do need to thank again, my dear friend. and we've had some tough issues. but the ranking member, lois frankel, who is who has been an amazing partner in putting this bill together. and by the way, chairman brian mast, another floridian who has been incredibly helpful. i also want to thank my staff, the amazing staff. this bill would have never happened without them. the clerk, my my clerk susan, susan adams and the entire majority team as well as the minority staff. we have no greater duty to the american people than to protect the security of our country while safeguarding tax dollars. this bill does. this second gentleman, mr. chairman, this bill does that. it protects our national security. it protec

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 13, 2026 1:30pm-3:39pm EST
appearances.snippet: that's a decision for rosa delauro and tom cole. michael. president trump will be in detroit today on the economy. i wanted to our reaction to the fact that he's now kind of turning his attention away from all of the international affairs that he's focused on in the last year and trying to focus on the economy and affordability proposals that he will help republicans and everything that i think we'll see. michael, he tends to distract himself when he starts talking about affordability. but if he wants to talk about how we lower the costs that people face, whether that's credit costs or housing costs, democrats are all ears. pleased that he picked up the phone and called elizabeth warren after after her speech yesterday. if he wants to meet with house democrats or senate democrats, i would imagine he knows how to find us. and we will carry forward our focus and our mission on lowering the costs that people face. but if he is set on using the department of justice to weaponize. to go after the fed, to go after the fed chair, look, we're not in
